poem:
These times, so full of gasps for nothing done,
 Hide truth behind the sound of rain that roars {'
'}Above a peak hour rush. These streets, once drenched 
 And quiet, have no-one left to stop and hear. 

 But I have walked the night and braved the storm 
 To find desertion midst these city lights. 
 So I have heard the voice of God entrapped 
 Beneath one wayward honk in search of home.
